meanings.definition: The act of carrying or transporting a boat or its cargo over land between two bodies of water.
meanings.sent1: The portaged of the canoe was tiring but necessary.
meanings.sent2: The portaged of the fishing boat was done carefully to avoid damage.
meanings.sent3: The portaged of the kayak seemed like a dance on dry land.
meanings.sent4: The portaged of the sailboat was like a pilgrimage across the shore.
meanings.sent5: The portaged of the rowboat left deep tracks in the sand.

meanings.definition: To carry or transport a boat or its cargo over land between two bodies of water.
meanings.sent1: They portaged the small boat across the narrow strip of land.
meanings.sent2: We portaged our gear to the other side of the lake.
meanings.sent3: He portaged the canoe with a determined look on his face.
meanings.sent4: She portaged the kayak effortlessly, like a pro.
meanings.sent5: The team portaged the heavy boat together, showing great teamwork.
